Raybon_Brothers:
{{Infobox musical artist | name = Raybon Brothers | image = | caption = | image_size = | background = group_or_band | origin = [[Florida]], United States | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | years_active = 1997 | label = [[MCA Nashville]] |spinoff_of = [[Shenandoah (band)|Shenandoah]] | past_members = [[Marty Raybon]]
Tim Raybon }} '''Raybon Brothers''' were an American [[country music]] duo from [[Sanford, Florida]], consisting of brothers [[Marty Raybon]] and Tim Raybon. Prior to the duo's inception in 1997, Marty Raybon was the lead singer of the country music band [[Shenandoah (band)|Shenandoah]], having left in 1997, before rejoining in 2014.{{cite web |url=http://www.gibson.com/player/apr03/raybon.html |title=Marty Raybon scratches his bluegrass itch |accessdate=2008-07-28 |last=Nikolai |first=Michelle |work=Gibson Guitar Corporation |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080719161854/http://www.gibson.com/player/apr03/Raybon.html |archivedate=2008-07-19}} The Raybon Brothers charted in 1997 with a cover of [[Bob Carlisle]]'s pop hit "[[Butterfly Kisses (song)|Butterfly Kisses]]". Their version was a top 40 hit on both the ''Billboard'' country music charts and the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]]. A second single, "The Way She's Lookin'", reached the lower regions of the country charts. Marty recorded a number of solo projects before rejoining Shenandoah. ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! style="width:12em;"| Title ! style="width:18em;"| Album details |- ! scope="row"| ''[[Raybon Brothers (album)|Raybon Brothers]]'' | * Release date: August 26, 1997 * Label: [[MCA Records]] * Formats: [[Compact disc|CD]], [[Compact cassette|cassette]] |} ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2" style="width:18em;"| Single ! colspan="3"| Peak chart positions ! rowspan="2" style="width:8em;"| [[Music recording sales certification|Certifications]]
